subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 4

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Wait Commands in Selenium?
options: To pause the test for manual intervention
To observe and troubleshoot issues due to time lag and prevent ElementNotVisibleException
To slow down the internet connection
To wait for the developer to fix the code
questions.correct_answer: To observe and troubleshoot issues due to time lag and prevent ElementNotVisibleException

questions.question: Which exception is commonly encountered when a web element is delayed in loading?
What does Implicit Wait do?
options: It waits for a specific condition to be met
It directs the WebDriver to wait for a certain measure of time before throwing an exception
It waits only for the first element found
questions.correct_answer: It directs the WebDriver to wait for a certain measure of time before throwing an exception

questions.question: What is the scope of an Implicit Wait once set? [cite: 655]
options: It applies only to the next line of code
It stays in place for the entire duration the browser is open
It applies only to button elements
It must be reset after every command
questions.correct_answer: It stays in place for the entire duration the browser is open

questions.question: What is the default time setting for Implicit Wait? [cite: 656]
When is Explicit Wait most effective? [cite: 664, 726]
options: When elements take a long time to load or require specific conditions
When you want to apply a wait to all elements globally
When testing static pages with no Ajax
When you don't know the element ID
questions.correct_answer: When elements take a long time to load or require specific conditions

questions.question: Which class is used to declare an Explicit Wait?
What must be used in conjunction with Explicit Wait to define the wait criteria? [cite: 670]
Which of the following is NOT a valid ExpectedCondition? [cite: 673-682]
What is a key difference between Implicit and Explicit waits? [cite: 726]
options: Implicit wait applies to all elements; Explicit wait applies to specific elements
Explicit wait is faster than Implicit wait
Implicit wait requires ExpectedConditions; Explicit wait does not
questions.correct_answer: Implicit wait applies to all elements; Explicit wait applies to specific elements

questions.question: What characterizes a Fluent Wait? [cite: 700-701]
options: It waits indefinitely until the browser closes
It checks for a web element repeatedly at regular intervals until timeout or object found
It is used only for checking page titles
questions.correct_answer: It checks for a web element repeatedly at regular intervals until timeout or object found

questions.question: What is another name for Fluent Waits? [cite: 706]
What does Page Object Model (POM) create? [cite: 728]
options: An Object Repository for web UI elements
A new database for the application
A graphical user interface for the test runner
questions.correct_answer: An Object Repository for web UI elements

questions.question: What is a major advantage of using POM? [cite: 729]
options: It reduces code duplication and improves test maintenance
It eliminates the need for Java
questions.correct_answer: It reduces code duplication and improves test maintenance

questions.question: In POM, what should correspond to each web page in the application? [cite: 730]
What is Page Factory in Selenium? [cite: 742]
options: A third-party tool for generating reports
An inbuilt, optimized Page Object Model framework concept
A factory that produces Selenium code
questions.correct_answer: An inbuilt, optimized Page Object Model framework concept

questions.question: Which annotation is used in Page Factory to find WebElements? [cite: 746]
Which method is used to initialize web elements in Page Factory? [cite: 747]
What is the Actions class used for in Selenium? [cite: 809]
Which method performs a right-click action? [cite: 822]
Which Actions class method drags an element from one point and drops it to another? [cite: 820]
Which method shifts the mouse pointer to the center of an element? [cite: 821]
What is the syntax to invoke an Action class? [cite: 814]
The Select class in Selenium is used to interact with which HTML tag? [cite: 828]
Which method selects an option based on the text displayed to the user? [cite: 834]
How does `selectByIndex` work? [cite: 843]
options: It selects an option using its unique ID
It selects an option using the integer index number
It selects an option using the value attribute
It selects the first available option
questions.correct_answer: It selects an option using the integer index number

questions.question: What does the `getOptions()` method return? [cite: 859]
What is an iFrame? [cite: 867]
options: An inline frame embedded in another web page
questions.correct_answer: An inline frame embedded in another web page

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to switch to an iFrame? [cite: 878-881]
What is the index of the first iFrame on a page? [cite: 884]
How can you manually identify an iFrame on a web page? [cite: 871]
options: Right click and look for 'This Frame' option
questions.correct_answer: Right click and look for 'This Frame' option

questions.question: Which command is used to perform a key release action? [cite: 825]
Which Selenium class provides keys like `Keys.SHIFT` or `Keys.ARROW_UP`? [cite: 893-900]
